intro: Dondia wilsonii, commonly known as the Wilson's dondia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions of South Africa and Namibia. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color. Dondia wilsonii is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience to harsh conditions.
